title: Exponential and Logarithmic - Rewriting and Solving - Part A

content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>f</mn> </math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadAgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B19@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a real number.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>log</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C5E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaaikdacaWG4bGaey4kaSIaaG4maiaadIhaaaa@3A9E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A32@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>3</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F89@</annotation> </semantics> </math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part A

The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>4</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>6</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4393@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4364@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadEgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mn>7</mn> <mi>c</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>c</mi> </math> is a constant.

(ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> are constants.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>4</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mn>7</mn> <mn>6</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4393@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4364@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadEgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup> <mn>7</mn> <mi>c</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>c</mi> </math> is a constant.

(ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> are constants.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
